00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.

00036  * lustre/obdclass/upcall_cache.c

00038  * Supplementary groups cache.

00040 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_SEC
00041 
00042 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00043 #include <lnet/types.h>
00044 #include <upcall_cache.h>
00045 
00046 static struct upcall_cache_entry *alloc_entry(struct upcall_cache *cache,
00047                                               __u64 key, void *args)
00048 {
00049         struct upcall_cache_entry *entry;
00050 
00051         LIBCFS_ALLOC(entry, sizeof(*entry));
00052         if (!entry)
00053                 return NULL;
00054 
00055         UC_CACHE_SET_NEW(entry);
00056         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&entry->ue_hash);
00057         entry->ue_key = key;
00058         atomic_set(&entry->ue_refcount, 0);
00059         init_waitqueue_head(&entry->ue_waitq);
00060         if (cache->uc_ops->init_entry)
00061                 cache->uc_ops->init_entry(entry, args);
00062         return entry;
00063 }
00064 
00065 /* protected by cache lock */
00066 static void free_entry(struct upcall_cache *cache,
00067                        struct upcall_cache_entry *entry)
00068 {
00069         if (cache->uc_ops->free_entry)
00070                 cache->uc_ops->free_entry(cache, entry);
00071 
00072         list_del(&entry->ue_hash);
00073         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "destroy cache entry %p for key "LPU64"\n",
00074                 entry, entry->ue_key);
00075         LIBCFS_FREE(entry, sizeof(*entry));
00076 }
00077 
00078 static inline int upcall_compare(struct upcall_cache *cache,
00079                                  struct upcall_cache_entry *entry,
00080                                  __u64 key, void *args)
00081 {
00082         if (entry->ue_key != key)
00083                 return -1;
00084 
00085         if (cache->uc_ops->upcall_compare)
00086                 return cache->uc_ops->upcall_compare(cache, entry, key, args);
00087 
00088         return 0;
00089 }
00090 
00091 static inline int downcall_compare(struct upcall_cache *cache,
00092                                    struct upcall_cache_entry *entry,
00093                                    __u64 key, void *args)
00094 {
00095         if (entry->ue_key != key)
00096                 return -1;
00097 
00098         if (cache->uc_ops->downcall_compare)
00099                 return cache->uc_ops->downcall_compare(cache, entry, key, args);
00100 
00101         return 0;
00102 }
00103 
00104 static inline void get_entry(struct upcall_cache_entry *entry)
00105 {
00106         atomic_inc(&entry->ue_refcount);
00107 }
00108 
00109 static inline void put_entry(struct upcall_cache *cache,
00110                              struct upcall_cache_entry *entry)
00111 {
00112         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&entry->ue_refcount) &&
00113             (UC_CACHE_IS_INVALID(entry) || UC_CACHE_IS_EXPIRED(entry))) {
00114                 free_entry(cache, entry);
00115         }
00116 }
00117 
00118 static int check_unlink_entry(struct upcall_cache *cache,
00119                               struct upcall_cache_entry *entry)
00120 {
00121         if (UC_CACHE_IS_VALID(entry) &&
00122             cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(), entry->ue_expire))
00123                 return 0;
00124 
00125         if (UC_CACHE_IS_ACQUIRING(entry)) {
00126                 if (entry->ue_acquire_expire == 0 ||
00127                     cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(),
00128                                     entry->ue_acquire_expire))
00129                         return 0;
00130 
00131                 UC_CACHE_SET_EXPIRED(entry);
00132                 wake_up_all(&entry->ue_waitq);
00133         } else if (!UC_CACHE_IS_INVALID(entry)) {
00134                 UC_CACHE_SET_EXPIRED(entry);
00135         }
00136 
00137         list_del_init(&entry->ue_hash);
00138         if (!atomic_read(&entry->ue_refcount))
00139                 free_entry(cache, entry);
00140         return 1;
00141 }
00142 
00143 static inline int refresh_entry(struct upcall_cache *cache,
00144                          struct upcall_cache_entry *entry)
00145 {
00146         LASSERT(cache->uc_ops->do_upcall);
00147         return cache->uc_ops->do_upcall(cache, entry);
00148 }
00149 
00150 struct upcall_cache_entry *upcall_cache_get_entry(struct upcall_cache *cache,
00151                                                   __u64 key, void *args)
00152 {
00153         struct upcall_cache_entry *entry = NULL, *new = NULL, *next;
00154         struct list_head *head;
00155         wait_queue_t wait;
00156         int rc, found;
00157         ENTRY;
00158 
00159         LASSERT(cache);
00160 
00161         head = &cache->uc_hashtable[UC_CACHE_HASH_INDEX(key)];
00162 find_again:
00163         found = 0;
00164         spin_lock(&cache->uc_lock);
00165         list_for_each_entry_safe(entry, next, head, ue_hash) {
00166                 /* check invalid & expired items */
00167                 if (check_unlink_entry(cache, entry))
00168                         continue;
00169                 if (upcall_compare(cache, entry, key, args) == 0) {
00170                         found = 1;
00171                         break;
00172                 }
00173         }
00174 
00175         if (!found) {
00176                 if (!new) {
00177                         spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00178                         new = alloc_entry(cache, key, args);
00179                         if (!new) {
00180                                 CERROR("fail to alloc entry\n");
00181                                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00182                         }
00183                         goto find_again;
00184                 } else {
00185                         list_add(&new->ue_hash, head);
00186                         entry = new;
00187                 }
00188         } else {
00189                 if (new) {
00190                         free_entry(cache, new);
00191                         new = NULL;
00192                 }
00193                 list_move(&entry->ue_hash, head);
00194         }
00195         get_entry(entry);
00196 
00197         /* acquire for new one */
00198         if (UC_CACHE_IS_NEW(entry)) {
00199                 UC_CACHE_SET_ACQUIRING(entry);
00200                 UC_CACHE_CLEAR_NEW(entry);
00201                 spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00202                 rc = refresh_entry(cache, entry);
00203                 spin_lock(&cache->uc_lock);
00204                 entry->ue_acquire_expire =
00205                         cfs_time_shift(cache->uc_acquire_expire);
00206                 if (rc < 0) {
00207                         UC_CACHE_CLEAR_ACQUIRING(entry);
00208                         UC_CACHE_SET_INVALID(entry);
00209                         wake_up_all(&entry->ue_waitq);
00210                         if (unlikely(rc == -EREMCHG)) {
00211                                 put_entry(cache, entry);
00212                                 GOTO(out, entry = ERR_PTR(rc));
00213                         }
00214                 }
00215         }
00216         /* someone (and only one) is doing upcall upon this item,
00217          * wait it to complete */
00218         if (UC_CACHE_IS_ACQUIRING(entry)) {
00219                 long expiry = (entry == new) ?
00220                               cfs_time_seconds(cache->uc_acquire_expire) :
00221                               MAX_SCHEDULE_TIMEOUT;
00222                 long left;
00223 
00224                 init_waitqueue_entry(&wait, current);
00225                 add_wait_queue(&entry->ue_waitq, &wait);
00226                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00227                 spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00228 
00229                 left = schedule_timeout(expiry);
00230 
00231                 spin_lock(&cache->uc_lock);
00232                 remove_wait_queue(&entry->ue_waitq, &wait);
00233                 if (UC_CACHE_IS_ACQUIRING(entry)) {
00234                         /* we're interrupted or upcall failed in the middle */
00235                         rc = left > 0 ? -EINTR : -ETIMEDOUT;
00236                         CERROR("acquire for key "LPU64": error %d\n",
00237                                entry->ue_key, rc);
00238                         put_entry(cache, entry);
00239                         GOTO(out, entry = ERR_PTR(rc));
00240                 }
00241         }
00242 
00243         /* invalid means error, don't need to try again */
00244         if (UC_CACHE_IS_INVALID(entry)) {
00245                 put_entry(cache, entry);
00246                 GOTO(out, entry = ERR_PTR(-EIDRM));
00247         }
00248 
00249         /* check expired
00250          * We can't refresh the existing one because some
00251          * memory might be shared by multiple processes.
00252          */
00253         if (check_unlink_entry(cache, entry)) {
00254                 /* if expired, try again. but if this entry is
00255                  * created by me but too quickly turn to expired
00256                  * without any error, should at least give a
00257                  * chance to use it once.
00258                  */
00259                 if (entry != new) {
00260                         put_entry(cache, entry);
00261                         spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00262                         new = NULL;
00263                         goto find_again;
00264                 }
00265         }
00266 
00267         /* Now we know it's good */
00268 out:
00269         spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00270         RETURN(entry);
00271 }
00272 EXPORT_SYMBOL(upcall_cache_get_entry);
00273 
00274 void upcall_cache_put_entry(struct upcall_cache *cache,
00275                             struct upcall_cache_entry *entry)
00276 {
00277         ENTRY;
00278 
00279         if (!entry) {
00280                 EXIT;
00281                 return;
00282         }
00283 
00284         LASSERT(atomic_read(&entry->ue_refcount) > 0);
00285         spin_lock(&cache->uc_lock);
00286         put_entry(cache, entry);
00287         spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00288         EXIT;
00289 }
00290 EXPORT_SYMBOL(upcall_cache_put_entry);
00291 
00292 int upcall_cache_downcall(struct upcall_cache *cache, __u32 err, __u64 key,
00293                           void *args)
00294 {
00295         struct upcall_cache_entry *entry = NULL;
00296         struct list_head *head;
00297         int found = 0, rc = 0;
00298         ENTRY;
00299 
00300         LASSERT(cache);
00301 
00302         head = &cache->uc_hashtable[UC_CACHE_HASH_INDEX(key)];
00303 
00304         spin_lock(&cache->uc_lock);
00305         list_for_each_entry(entry, head, ue_hash) {
00306                 if (downcall_compare(cache, entry, key, args) == 0) {
00307                         found = 1;
00308                         get_entry(entry);
00309                         break;
00310                 }
00311         }
00312 
00313         if (!found) {
00314                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: upcall for key "LPU64" not expected\n",
00315                        cache->uc_name, key);
00316                 /* haven't found, it's possible */
00317                 spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00318                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00319         }
00320 
00321         if (err) {
00322                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: upcall for key "LPU64" returned %d\n",
00323                        cache->uc_name, entry->ue_key, err);
00324                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00325         }
00326 
00327         if (!UC_CACHE_IS_ACQUIRING(entry)) {
00328                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "%s: found uptodate entry %p (key "LPU64")"
00329                        "\n", cache->uc_name, entry, entry->ue_key);
00330                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00331         }
00332 
00333         if (UC_CACHE_IS_INVALID(entry) || UC_CACHE_IS_EXPIRED(entry)) {
00334                 CERROR("%s: found a stale entry %p (key "LPU64") in ioctl\n",
00335                        cache->uc_name, entry, entry->ue_key);
00336                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00337         }
00338 
00339         spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00340         if (cache->uc_ops->parse_downcall)
00341                 rc = cache->uc_ops->parse_downcall(cache, entry, args);
00342         spin_lock(&cache->uc_lock);
00343         if (rc)
00344                 GOTO(out, rc);
00345 
00346         entry->ue_expire = cfs_time_shift(cache->uc_entry_expire);
00347         UC_CACHE_SET_VALID(entry);
00348         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: created upcall cache entry %p for key "LPU64"\n",
00349                cache->uc_name, entry, entry->ue_key);
00350 out:
00351         if (rc) {
00352                 UC_CACHE_SET_INVALID(entry);
00353                 list_del_init(&entry->ue_hash);
00354         }
00355         UC_CACHE_CLEAR_ACQUIRING(entry);
00356         spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00357         wake_up_all(&entry->ue_waitq);
00358         put_entry(cache, entry);
00359 
00360         RETURN(rc);
00361 }
00362 EXPORT_SYMBOL(upcall_cache_downcall);
00363 
00364 void upcall_cache_flush(struct upcall_cache *cache, int force)
00365 {
00366         struct upcall_cache_entry *entry, *next;
00367         int i;
00368         ENTRY;
00369 
00370         spin_lock(&cache->uc_lock);
00371         for (i = 0; i < UC_CACHE_HASH_SIZE; i++) {
00372                 list_for_each_entry_safe(entry, next,
00373                                          &cache->uc_hashtable[i], ue_hash) {
00374                         if (!force && atomic_read(&entry->ue_refcount)) {
00375                                 UC_CACHE_SET_EXPIRED(entry);
00376                                 continue;
00377                         }
00378                         LASSERT(!atomic_read(&entry->ue_refcount));
00379                         free_entry(cache, entry);
00380                 }
00381         }
00382         spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00383         EXIT;
00384 }
00385 EXPORT_SYMBOL(upcall_cache_flush);
00386 
00387 void upcall_cache_flush_one(struct upcall_cache *cache, __u64 key, void *args)
00388 {
00389         struct list_head *head;
00390         struct upcall_cache_entry *entry;
00391         int found = 0;
00392         ENTRY;
00393 
00394         head = &cache->uc_hashtable[UC_CACHE_HASH_INDEX(key)];
00395 
00396         spin_lock(&cache->uc_lock);
00397         list_for_each_entry(entry, head, ue_hash) {
00398                 if (upcall_compare(cache, entry, key, args) == 0) {
00399                         found = 1;
00400                         break;
00401                 }
00402         }
00403 
00404         if (found) {
00405                 CWARN("%s: flush entry %p: key "LPU64", ref %d, fl %x, "
00406                       "cur %lu, ex %ld/%ld\n",
00407                       cache->uc_name, entry, entry->ue_key,
00408                       atomic_read(&entry->ue_refcount), entry->ue_flags,
00409                       cfs_time_current_sec(), entry->ue_acquire_expire,
00410                       entry->ue_expire);
00411                 UC_CACHE_SET_EXPIRED(entry);
00412                 if (!atomic_read(&entry->ue_refcount))
00413                         free_entry(cache, entry);
00414         }
00415         spin_unlock(&cache->uc_lock);
00416 }
00417 EXPORT_SYMBOL(upcall_cache_flush_one);
00418 
00419 struct upcall_cache *upcall_cache_init(const char *name, const char *upcall,
00420                                        struct upcall_cache_ops *ops)
00421 {
00422         struct upcall_cache *cache;
00423         int i;
00424         ENTRY;
00425 
00426         LIBCFS_ALLOC(cache, sizeof(*cache));
00427         if (!cache)
00428                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00429 
00430         spin_lock_init(&cache->uc_lock);
00431         rwlock_init(&cache->uc_upcall_rwlock);
00432         for (i = 0; i < UC_CACHE_HASH_SIZE; i++)
00433                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cache->uc_hashtable[i]);
00434         strlcpy(cache->uc_name, name, sizeof(cache->uc_name));
00435         /* upcall pathname proc tunable */
00436         strlcpy(cache->uc_upcall, upcall, sizeof(cache->uc_upcall));
00437         cache->uc_entry_expire = 20 * 60;
00438         cache->uc_acquire_expire = 30;
00439         cache->uc_ops = ops;
00440 
00441         RETURN(cache);
00442 }
00443 EXPORT_SYMBOL(upcall_cache_init);
00444 
00445 void upcall_cache_cleanup(struct upcall_cache *cache)
00446 {
00447         if (!cache)
00448                 return;
00449         upcall_cache_flush_all(cache);
00450         LIBCFS_FREE(cache, sizeof(*cache));
00451 }
00452 EXPORT_SYMBOL(upcall_cache_cleanup);
